column5: I don't know why, but the smoking Angel has always been my fave   Awesome paintings, all of them
This peice of your work is the perfect illustration of a few times i've had while out Pitchin fishin and the mixed bag of treats i went home with as any fishermen can amagin .
Emotional work Bushart, stirred a few memory's. I can relate to the kid looking back under the dock.  Keep up the good work.

Thanks Joey----For some reasons--that Angel is a fav of many around the globe---I had posted it a while back on a German website---it seemed to garner the most attention  Thanks Skip-----just glad we did'nt open the great cottage dock pitchin debates again  Thanks IFH----yes I do wander down nostalgia lane from time to time
Your latest work "Pitching" is nothing short of excellence   Glad you got back into the brush beat Terrence Awesome job mon chum, as always
Merci, Mon Ami
I was born at a very early age...I believe with a fishin rod in hand
As a youngster my ole Uncle used to take me fishin
Then I had kids and had to teach them how to fish
Now other Members may think---that painter is quite a space cadet
I kinda used to like to smoke-----gave it up years ago---maybe in the next life we can again
Now of course I ain't goin till I absolutely have to
So Anyway for puttin up with me---here's my latest-------and yes it is fishin  callin it "Pitchin"---Ok I'm done now  24 x 36
Very nice!
Thanks for the trip down memory lane in your own special way.    Art
Sweet paintings!   G
Where you been hiding this one? It,s awesome Terrance.
Thanks Chris---Art---and Gerritt  Have'nt painted for a while----so Just gettin my game back on
Just finished that one Bri---that's my latest   Now I'm fresh outta canvas'
Awesome Bushy !!! That one makes me itchy for softwater season again !!!  Keep posting bud, your art makes my day.
Very nice as always!!!
Thanks Merky---yes I'm already thinking of Spring  Thanks Davey B  Thanks Two----yes I use Berkley Gulp juice with my paints

I love the way you captured the underwater sunlight hitting the bass. You nailed it! Especially the one sneaking out from underneath the dock. Very nice. I do ok with pencil and charcoal etc.....but cannot grasp the concept of paint LOL Dunno how u do it

I love the way you captured the underwater sunlight hitting the bass. You nailed it! Especially the one sneaking out from underneath the dock. Very nice. I do ok with pencil and charcoal etc.....but cannot grasp the concept of paint LOL Dunno how u do it

Thanks Blaque---yes I've been guilty of pitchin docks in my life  Re: Painting-----It's easy----just mix one cup of lifetime experiences with 2 tbsps of confidence---2 parts cold beer  Mix well----heat to 98.6 degrees and your done.  Seriously...like anything...practice/practice/practice...and let yourself fail--and learn from it....dreams help
oh yeah...I'm sure everyone knows to click on the image to enlarge
Really like the new one! A great series. Thanks for showing.
How much for the pitching picture haha. Love it as well as the rest.

That was a great little trip!  Thanks Bushart!  My grandfather is a painter, and he just gave me 4 paintings from his little collection.  The first time he's given me a painting.  I'm pumped to get them hung in my house!
Thanks RC---every once in a while I get my head out of the clouds and get back to what I like doin  Thanks Live 2  Right on NAW-----Definetely something to cherish
